          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and they are planning to watch a soccer game later.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, this grass is scratchy.
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got good beer and plenty of screens.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good time.
      Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, I really hope they don't pick somewhere awful like The Crown and Anchor again. The beer there is flat and the music's always too loud.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone! So, where are we headed tonight? I'm thinking The King's Head, they always have a good atmosphere for the games.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for the games.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a good shout. They always have a good atmosphere for the games.
      Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out here, isn't it?
      Jack Taylor -- "This weather is perfect, isn't it?


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out here, isn't it?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "This weather is perfect, isn't it?
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out here, isn't it?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "This weather is perfect, isn't it?

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones spent time with friends at a market and a park, but had a disappointing experience watching a football game because not all his friends went to the same pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The King's Head. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they all go to The Clapton Hart to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest that everyone go to The Clapton Hart.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones spent time with friends at a market and a park, but had a disappointing experience watching a football game because not all his friends went to the same pub.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good bet for the game, isn't it?
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good bet for the game, isn't it?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, this grass is scratchy.
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got good beer and plenty of screens.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good time.
      Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, I really hope they don't pick somewhere awful like The Crown and Anchor again. The beer there is flat and the music's always too loud.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone! So, where are we headed tonight? I'm thinking The King's Head, they always have a good atmosphere for the games.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for the games.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a good shout. They always have a good atmosphere for the games.
      Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out here, isn't it?
      Jack Taylor -- "This weather is perfect, isn't it?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good bet for the game, isn't it?

          Key

          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out here, isn't it?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "This weather is perfect, isn't it?

          Value
        • Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good bet for the game, isn't it?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out here, isn't it?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "This weather is perfect, isn't it?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White was recently seen enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park. Later that evening, his friends discussed plans to watch a soccer game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The King's Head. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to a pub to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good bet for the game, isn't it?

Alexander White just arrived.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alexander White was recently seen enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park. Later that evening, his friends discussed plans to watch a soccer game at a pub.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "I don't know about The King's Head, the beer there is always flat.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "I don't know about The King's Head, the beer there is always flat.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, this grass is scratchy.
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got good beer and plenty of screens.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good time.
      Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, I really hope they don't pick somewhere awful like The Crown and Anchor again. The beer there is flat and the music's always too loud.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone! So, where are we headed tonight? I'm thinking The King's Head, they always have a good atmosphere for the games.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for the games.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a good shout. They always have a good atmosphere for the games.
      Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out here, isn't it?
      Jack Taylor -- "This weather is perfect, isn't it?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good bet for the game, isn't it?

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a chronic complainer, a black hole of negativity that sucks the joy out of any conversation, leaving you feeling like you've aged a decade.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introverted person who enjoys spending time with close friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends outdoors but is feeling emotionally isolated. His friends are discussing where to watch a soccer game later that evening.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, but he feels lonely and isolated.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to find solace in the company of his friends and hope for a more positive experience.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "I don't know about The King's Head, the beer there is always flat.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to enjoy the company of his friends and hope for a more positive experience than the previous night.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, I really hope they don't pick somewhere awful like The Crown and Anchor again. The beer there is flat and the music's always too loud.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone! So, where are we headed tonight? I'm thinking The King's Head, they always have a good atmosphere for the games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for the games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a good shout. They always have a good atmosphere for the games.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The King's Head. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

Jacob Walker just arrived.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a chronic complainer, a black hole of negativity that sucks the joy out of any conversation, leaving you feeling like you've aged a decade.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introverted person who enjoys spending time with close friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is experiencing emotional pain and loneliness and is planning to watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently feeling lonely and is going to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to find solace in the company of his friends and hope for a more positive experience.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Clapton Hart

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is experiencing emotional pain and loneliness and is planning to watch a game at a pub.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones had a disappointing time watching a game at The Clapton Hart on May 15th but is planning to watch another game with friends at a pub on May 16th.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Clapton Hart to his friends, or he could go along with the group's decision even if it is not his first choice.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Clapton Hart to his friends.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The King's Head
          Answer: (a)
        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones could suggest going to The Clapton Hart to his friends, or he could go along with the group's decision even if it is not his first choice.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got good beer and plenty of screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good time.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, I really hope they don't pick somewhere awful like The Crown and Anchor again. The beer there is flat and the music's always too loud.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone! So, where are we headed tonight? I'm thinking The King's Head, they always have a good atmosphere for the games.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The King's Head. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out here, isn't it?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "This weather is perfect, isn't it?

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The King's Head

  • Alice Lewis
      Name

      Action attempt

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The King's Head
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub. She was getting ready to leave for the pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely want to go to a pub with her friends to watch the game and enjoy their company.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a social and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely want to go to a pub with her friends to watch the game and enjoy their company.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The King's Head
          Answer: (b)

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alice Lewis to consider right now. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The King's Head. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is lively and energetic, especially during big games.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be excited to be watching the game with her friends and would be looking forward to a fun evening.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely want to go to a pub with her friends to watch the game and enjoy their company.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone! So, where are we headed tonight? I'm thinking The King's Head, they always have a good atmosphere for the games.

        Question_3
      • What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis would likely want to go to a pub with her friends to watch the game and enjoy their company.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a social and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely want to go to a pub with her friends to watch the game and enjoy their company.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone! So, where are we headed tonight? I'm thinking The King's Head, they always have a good atmosphere for the games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for the games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a good shout. They always have a good atmosphere for the games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, I really hope they don't pick somewhere awful like The Crown and Anchor again. The beer there is flat and the music's always too loud.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely want to go to a pub with her friends to watch the game and enjoy their company.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a social and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a social and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be enjoying the company of her friends and the sunshine.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out here, isn't it?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "This weather is perfect, isn't it?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good bet for the game, isn't it?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "I don't know about The King's Head, the beer there is always flat.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a social and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely want to go to a pub with her friends to watch the game and enjoy their company.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        Question_1

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely want to go to a pub with her friends to watch the game and enjoy their company.

          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub. She was getting ready to leave for the pub.

  • scoring function
      Stage index

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The King's Head

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The King's Head
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White would likely suggest going to a pub to watch the game.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to go watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to a pub to watch the game.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (a)

          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to go watch a football game with his friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to a pub to watch the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone! So, where are we headed tonight? I'm thinking The King's Head, they always have a good atmosphere for the games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest The King's Head as the pub to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for the games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a good shout. They always have a good atmosphere for the games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, I really hope they don't pick somewhere awful like The Crown and Anchor again. The beer there is flat and the music's always too loud.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest The King's Head as the pub to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The King's Head. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out here, isn't it?

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key
        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          ['[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] ']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and introspective person who values his friendships and enjoys watching football with his friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently deciding where to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Clapton Hart, as it is his favorite pub and he knows they have good beer and plenty of screens for watching the game.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (b)

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a good shout. They always have a good atmosphere for the games.

Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently deciding where to watch a football game with his friends.

        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White joined his friends for a relaxing afternoon in Victoria Park and will be watching the Andorra-Portugal game later with them.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The King's Head. They are also aware of the following:Has a pool table and dartboard for some friendly competition.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends before heading to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be suggesting The King's Head as the pub to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?

They spent weeks gathering materials, hammering, sawing, and arguing over the design, but finally, their creation stood tall, a testament to their combined imagination and youthful energy. Alexander, fueled by a desire to make their treehouse truly unique, designed a winding staircase that led to a trapdoor entrance hidden amongst the branches, making it feel like a secret world accessible only to them.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.


          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White joined his friends for a relaxing afternoon in Victoria Park and will be watching the Andorra-Portugal game later with them.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends before heading to a pub to watch a football game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key
        • Summary of recent observations
          Value

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, this grass is scratchy.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, this grass is scratchy.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, this grass is scratchy.

        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he stood backstage at the school play, his stomach churning with anxiety. He’d been cast as the lead, Romeo, but the thought of facing the audience, of baring his soul under the stage lights, filled him with dread. He mumbled an excuse about a sudden illness and slipped out the back door, leaving his friends and the disappointed director behind; the memory of their disappointed faces still haunted him.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:A modern and stylish pub with a vibrant atmosphere.

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a chronic complainer, a black hole of negativity that sucks the joy out of any conversation, leaving you feeling like you've aged a decade.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introverted person who enjoys spending time with close friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and will be watching the Andorra-Portugal game later that evening.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends and the pleasant atmosphere.

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, this grass is scratchy.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got good beer and plenty of screens.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got good beer and plenty of screens.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, this grass is scratchy.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got good beer and plenty of screens.

However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic.
