          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00 - 14 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones and his friends are enjoying a sunny day at the park before heading to a pub to watch a European football cup game. They are deciding which pub to go to.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest The Clapton Hart as the pub to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Clapton Hart as the pub to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got good beer and plenty of screens.

          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he was invited to a party at a friend’s house. He spent the entire evening huddled in a corner, observing the other teenagers laughing and dancing, feeling a deep sense of alienation and convinced that he didn't belong. The experience reinforced his belief that social gatherings were nothing but a breeding ground for disappointment.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, this grass is scratchy.
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got good beer and plenty of screens.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and introspective person who values his friendships and enjoys watching football with his friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game later.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Clapton Hart, as it is his favorite pub and he knows they have good beer and plenty of screens for watching the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he found himself standing at the edge of a crowded dance floor, watching Alice Lewis twirl with another boy. A wave of jealousy washed over him, a feeling he couldn't quite understand, but it made his chest ache. He retreated to a corner booth, nursing a soda and pretending to be absorbed in a book, his heart yearning for the closeness he both craved and feared.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:Serves innovative and globally-inspired cuisine.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, this grass is scratchy.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got good beer and plenty of screens.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and introspective person who values his friendships and enjoys watching football with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game later.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Clapton Hart, as it is his favorite pub and he knows they have good beer and plenty of screens for watching the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00
        Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is a reserved and introspective person who values his friendships and enjoys watching football with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he found himself standing at the edge of a crowded dance floor, watching Alice Lewis twirl with another boy. A wave of jealousy washed over him, a feeling he couldn't quite understand, but it made his chest ache. He retreated to a corner booth, nursing a soda and pretending to be absorbed in a book, his heart yearning for the closeness he both craved and feared.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park to join his friends who are lounging on a blanket. The friends are deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game later that night.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game later.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park to join his friends who are lounging on a blanket. The friends are deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game later that night.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good time.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good time.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, this grass is scratchy.
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got good beer and plenty of screens.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good time.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a social and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be engaged in conversation and enjoying the company of her friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she decided to run for student body president, driven by a burning desire to be seen and heard. She poured her heart into her campaign speech, her voice trembling slightly as she promised to be a voice for the voiceless, vowing to make their school a better place. The victory, when it came, was intoxicating, validating her belief that she could command a room and make a difference.

          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, I really hope they don't pick somewhere awful like The Crown and Anchor again. The beer there is flat and the music's always too loud.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, I really hope they don't pick somewhere awful like The Crown and Anchor again. The beer there is flat and the music's always too loud.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, this grass is scratchy.
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got good beer and plenty of screens.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good time.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, I really hope they don't pick somewhere awful like The Crown and Anchor again. The beer there is flat and the music's always too loud.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, I really hope they don't pick somewhere awful like The Crown and Anchor again. The beer there is flat and the music's always too loud.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.


          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a chronic complainer, a black hole of negativity that sucks the joy out of any conversation, leaving you feeling like you've aged a decade.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introverted person who enjoys spending time with close friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker was recently observed at a market with friends and is planning to watch a soccer game with them later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with friends, but may be feeling apprehensive due to a previous negative experience.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to enjoy the company of his friends and hope for a more positive experience than the previous night.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, I really hope they don't pick somewhere awful like The Crown and Anchor again. The beer there is flat and the music's always too loud.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone! So, where are we headed tonight? I'm thinking The King's Head, they always have a good atmosphere for the games.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone! So, where are we headed tonight? I'm thinking The King's Head, they always have a good atmosphere for the games.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, this grass is scratchy.
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got good beer and plenty of screens.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good time.
      Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, I really hope they don't pick somewhere awful like The Crown and Anchor again. The beer there is flat and the music's always too loud.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone! So, where are we headed tonight? I'm thinking The King's Head, they always have a good atmosphere for the games.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be excited to be watching the game with her friends and would be looking forward to a fun evening.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a social and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting with friends, deciding where to watch a football game later.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely want to go to a pub with her friends to watch the game and enjoy their company.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got good beer and plenty of screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be engaged in conversation and enjoying the company of her friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good time.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, this grass is scratchy.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a social and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a social and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be excited to be watching the game with her friends and would be looking forward to a fun evening.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, I really hope they don't pick somewhere awful like The Crown and Anchor again. The beer there is flat and the music's always too loud.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, I really hope they don't pick somewhere awful like The Crown and Anchor again. The beer there is flat and the music's always too loud.


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at a market where her friends are gathered. They are deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game later that evening.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting with friends, deciding where to watch a football game later.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis just arrived at a market where her friends are gathered. They are deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game later that evening.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, this grass is scratchy.
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got good beer and plenty of screens.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good time.
      Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, I really hope they don't pick somewhere awful like The Crown and Anchor again. The beer there is flat and the music's always too loud.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone! So, where are we headed tonight? I'm thinking The King's Head, they always have a good atmosphere for the games.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, I really hope they don't pick somewhere awful like The Crown and Anchor again. The beer there is flat and the music's always too loud.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone! So, where are we headed tonight? I'm thinking The King's Head, they always have a good atmosphere for the games.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, often meeting them for picnics and to watch football games at pubs. He sometimes wishes more of his friends would join them for these outings.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest a pub to watch the game at; he could ask his friends where they want to go; or he could simply go along with whatever the group decides.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Clapton Hart as the pub for the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, I really hope they don't pick somewhere awful like The Crown and Anchor again. The beer there is flat and the music's always too loud.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone! So, where are we headed tonight? I'm thinking The King's Head, they always have a good atmosphere for the games.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, often meeting them for picnics and to watch football games at pubs. He sometimes wishes more of his friends would join them for these outings.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart.           [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest a pub to watch the game at; he could ask his friends where they want to go; or he could simply go along with whatever the group decides.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Clapton Hart as the pub for the game.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, often meeting them for picnics and to watch football games at pubs. He sometimes wishes more of his friends would join them for these outings.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for the games.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for the games.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, this grass is scratchy.
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got good beer and plenty of screens.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good time.
      Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, I really hope they don't pick somewhere awful like The Crown and Anchor again. The beer there is flat and the music's always too loud.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone! So, where are we headed tonight? I'm thinking The King's Head, they always have a good atmosphere for the games.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for the games.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White just arrived at a market where his friends are deciding where to watch the Ireland-Russia game. They are considering The King's Head, The Clapton Hart, and The Crown and Anchor.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest The King's Head as the pub to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for the games.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely be suggesting The King's Head as the pub to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, this grass is scratchy.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got good beer and plenty of screens.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest The King's Head as the pub to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alexander White just arrived at a market where his friends are deciding where to watch the Ireland-Russia game. They are considering The King's Head, The Clapton Hart, and The Crown and Anchor.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a good shout. They always have a good atmosphere for the games.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a good shout. They always have a good atmosphere for the games.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, this grass is scratchy.
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got good beer and plenty of screens.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good time.
      Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, I really hope they don't pick somewhere awful like The Crown and Anchor again. The beer there is flat and the music's always too loud.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone! So, where are we headed tonight? I'm thinking The King's Head, they always have a good atmosphere for the games.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for the games.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a good shout. They always have a good atmosphere for the games.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, I really hope they don't pick somewhere awful like The Crown and Anchor again. The beer there is flat and the music's always too loud.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone! So, where are we headed tonight? I'm thinking The King's Head, they always have a good atmosphere for the games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for the games.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived to meet his friends at a market. They are deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game later that night.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Clapton Hart, as it is his favorite pub and he knows they have good beer and plenty of screens for watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and introspective person who values his friendships and enjoys watching football with his friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game later.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Clapton Hart, as it is his favorite pub and he knows they have good beer and plenty of screens for watching the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a good shout. They always have a good atmosphere for the games.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved and introspective person who values his friendships and enjoys watching football with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Clapton Hart, as it is his favorite pub and he knows they have good beer and plenty of screens for watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?

          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out here, isn't it?
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out here, isn't it?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, this grass is scratchy.
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got good beer and plenty of screens.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good time.
      Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, I really hope they don't pick somewhere awful like The Crown and Anchor again. The beer there is flat and the music's always too loud.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone! So, where are we headed tonight? I'm thinking The King's Head, they always have a good atmosphere for the games.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for the games.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a good shout. They always have a good atmosphere for the games.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out here, isn't it?

          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out here, isn't it?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis arrived at Victoria Park to join friends for a relaxing afternoon and later that evening she will be watching a soccer game with friends.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely want to go to a pub with her friends to watch the game and enjoy their company.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a social and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with friends.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a social and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be enjoying the company of her friends and the sunshine.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out here, isn't it?

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely want to go to a pub with her friends to watch the game and enjoy their company.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a social and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis arrived at Victoria Park to join friends for a relaxing afternoon and later that evening she will be watching a soccer game with friends.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with friends in a park.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis arrived at Victoria Park to join friends for a relaxing afternoon and later that evening she will be watching a soccer game with friends.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "This weather is perfect, isn't it?
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "This weather is perfect, isn't it?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, this grass is scratchy.
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got good beer and plenty of screens.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good time.
      Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, I really hope they don't pick somewhere awful like The Crown and Anchor again. The beer there is flat and the music's always too loud.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone! So, where are we headed tonight? I'm thinking The King's Head, they always have a good atmosphere for the games.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for the games.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a good shout. They always have a good atmosphere for the games.
      Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out here, isn't it?


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "This weather is perfect, isn't it?

          Value

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "This weather is perfect, isn't it?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out here, isn't it?

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and they are planning to watch a soccer game later.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and introspective person who values his friendships and enjoys watching football with his friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely enjoy the company of his friends and the pleasant weather.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "This weather is perfect, isn't it?

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and they are planning to watch a soccer game later.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, this grass is scratchy.
      William Jones -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They've got good beer and plenty of screens.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head is always a good time.
      Jacob Walker -- "Ugh, I really hope they don't pick somewhere awful like The Crown and Anchor again. The beer there is flat and the music's always too loud.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone! So, where are we headed tonight? I'm thinking The King's Head, they always have a good atmosphere for the games.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head is always a good shout for the games.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a good shout. They always have a good atmosphere for the games.
      Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out here, isn't it?
      Jack Taylor -- "This weather is perfect, isn't it?


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart tonight? They've got great beer and it's always a good atmosphere for the games.
